name: Choquequirao To Machu Picchu, 8 Days
description:
While Machu Picchu is well known, less is known about Choquequirao.
The archaeological site of CHOQUEQUIRAO is part of the complex system of Andean towns at Vilcabamba Valley in the time of the Incas, it was linked to Machu Picchu by a complex network of trails. Choquequirao is located in the spurs of the mountain range of Salcantay at 3050 m, 10006 ft. surrounded by nevados of Yanama, Ampay, Choquetacarpo, Pumasillo and Panta on the right side of Apurimac river. Choquequirao is an Inca town formed by small sites, forming a complex metropolis placed on the crest of the mountain called Choquequirao.
Plus its unique sights along the way of nevados, canyons, rivers, cloud forest, local lifestyle, condors, pumas, spectacled bears, orchids, coffee plantations, banana trees, etc.
